page.title: 10BOSTON WEST INTERVIEW P2
page.content: Here was a{livestock sale .}The larger animals were driven through the town from the{railway station. Vegetables, {flowers}and other{odds}and{ends}were {auctioned}as well as having normal {market stalls.}The{Mayfair}took over the{Market Place and "Green"}for the {first week in May.}Other treats were { Sunday School outings}when{farm horse {carts}were{decorated}and would go into the{country}and have a{picnic or go to {Skegness by train. At 16 years old {Mrs. Patterson}worked in{Woolworths until she got{married.}Then the familiy lived in{Argyle Street.}There were{three children.}When the family moved to{Rosebery Ave.}there were only {8 houses}and it was known as{Sherwood {Ave. .E.C.Stanwell,father,was a mayor {of BOSTON visited Boston U.S.A.and {accepted silver plate for the Mayor's {Parlour.
